arshift.name: bit.arshift
arshift.description:
Returns the bitwise arithmetic right-shift of its first argument by the number of bits given by the second argument.
Arithmetic right-shift treats the most-significant bit as a sign bit and replicates it.
Only the lower 5 bits of the shift count are used (reduces to the range [0..31]).

band.name: bit.band
band.description: Returns the bitwise and of all of its arguments. Note that more than two arguments are allowed.

bnot.name: bit.bnot
bnot.description: Returns the bitwise not of its argument.

bor.name: bit.bor
bor.description: Returns the bitwise or of all of its arguments. Note that more than two arguments are allowed.

bswap.name: bit.bswap
bswap.description: Swaps the bytes of its argument and returns it. This can be used to convert little-endian 32 bit numbers to big-endian 32 bit numbers or vice versa.

bxor.name: bit.bxor
bxor.description: Returns the bitwise xor of all of its arguments. Note that more than two arguments are allowed.

lshift.name: bit.lshift
lshift.description:
Returns the bitwise logical left-shift of its first argument by the number of bits given by the second argument.
Logical shifts treat the first argument as an unsigned number and shift in 0-bits.
Only the lower 5 bits of the shift count are used (reduces to the range [0..31]).

rol.name: bit.rol
rol.description:
Returns the bitwise left rotation of its first argument by the number of bits given by the second argument. Bits shifted out on one side are shifted back in on the other side.
Only the lower 5 bits of the rotate count are used (reduces to the range [0..31]).

ror.name: bit.ror
ror.description:
Returns the bitwise right rotation of its first argument by the number of bits given by the second argument. Bits shifted out on one side are shifted back in on the other side.
Only the lower 5 bits of the rotate count are used (reduces to the range [0..31]).

rshift.name: bit.rshift
rshift.description:
Returns the bitwise logical right-shift of its first argument by the number of bits given by the second argument.
Logical shifts treat the first argument as an unsigned number and shift in 0-bits.
Only the lower 5 bits of the shift count are used (reduces to the range [0..31]).

tobit.name: bit.tobit
tobit.description: Normalizes a number to the numeric range for bit operations and returns it. This function is usually not needed since all bit operations already normalize all of their input arguments.

tohex.name: bit.tohex
tohex.description: Converts its first argument to a hex string. The number of hex digits is given by the absolute value of the optional second argument. Positive numbers between 1 and 8 generate lowercase hex digits. Negative numbers generate uppercase hex digits. Only the least-significant 4*|n| bits are used. The default is to generate 8 lowercase hex digits.

args.name: n
args.description: number of hex digits to return

set_event_callback.name: client.set_event_callback
set_event_callback.description: Raises an error and prints a message in console upon failure.

args.name: callback
args.description: Lua function to call when this event occurs.

log.name: client.log

args.description: Optional comma-separated arguments to concatenate with msg.

log.description: Logs a message to console in the [gamesense] format.

color_log.name: client.color_log

args.description: Optional comma-separated arguments to concatenate with msg.

color_log.description: Logs a colored message to console. End the string with \0 to prevent it from adding a newline.

exec.name: client.exec

args.description: Optional comma-separated arguments to concatenate with cmd.

exec.description: Executes a console command. Multiple commands can be combined with ';'. Be careful when passing user input (including usernames) to it.

userid_to_entindex.name: client.userid_to_entindex
userid_to_entindex.description: Returns the entity index, or 0 on failure.

args.name: userid
args.description: This is given by some game events.

draw_debug_text.name: client.draw_debug_text
draw_debug_text.description: Avoid calling this during the paint event.

args.name: line_offset
args.description: Used for vertical alignment, use 0 for the first line.

args.name: duration
args.description: Time in seconds that the text will remain on the screen.
The text that will be drawn

draw_hitboxes.name: client.draw_hitboxes
draw_hitboxes.description: Draws hitbox overlays. Avoid calling this during the paint event.

args.name: hitboxes
args.description: Either the hitbox index, an array of hitbox indices, or 19 for all hitboxes

random_int.name: client.random_int
random_int.description: Returns a random integer between minimum and maximum.

random_float.name: client.random_float
random_float.description: Returns a random float between minimum and maximum.

visible.name: client.visible
visible.description: Returns true if the position is visible. For example, you could use a player's origin to see if they are visible.

trace_line.name: client.trace_line
trace_line.description: Returns fraction, entindex. fraction is a percentage in the range [0.0, 1.0] that tells you how far the trace went before hitting something, so 1.0 means nothing was hit. entindex is the entity index that hit, or -1 if no entity was hit.

trace_bullet.name: client.trace_bullet
trace_bullet.description: Returns entindex, damage. Entindex is nil when no player is hit.

args.name: from_player
args.description: Entity index of the player whose weapon will be used for this trace

scale_damage.name: client.scale_damage
scale_damage.description: Returns adjusted damage for the specified hitgroup

delay_call.name: client.delay_call

args.name: delay
args.description: Time in seconds to wait before calling callback.

args.name: callback
args.description: The lua function that will be called after delay seconds.
Optional arguments that will be passed to the callback.

delay_call.description: Executes the callback after delay seconds, passing the arguments to it.

timestamp.name: client.timestamp
timestamp.description: Returns high precision timestamp in milliseconds.

eye_position.name: client.eye_position
eye_position.description: Returns x, y, z world coordinates of the local player's eye position, or nil on failure.

set_clan_tag.name: client.set_clan_tag
set_clan_tag.description: The clan tag is removed if no argument is passed or if it is an empty string. Additional arguments will be concatenated similar to client.log.

args.description: The text that will be drawn

system_time.name: client.system_time
system_time.description: Returns windows time as (hours, minutes, seconds, milliseconds)

reload_active_scripts.name: client.reload_active_scripts
reload_active_scripts.description: Reloads all scripts the following frame.

camera_position.name: client.camera_position
camera_position.description: Returns x, y, z world coordinates of the game's camera position, or nil on failure.

unset_event_callback.name: client.unset_event_callback
unset_event_callback.description: Removes the event callback for the passed event name and function. Raises an error and prints a message in console upon failure.

key_state.name: client.key_state
key_state.description: Returns true if the key is pressed, or nil on failure

args.name: key
args.description: Virtual key code of the key as integer. [List of virtual key codes](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/desktop/inputdev/virtual-key-codes)

update_player_list.name: client.update_player_list
update_player_list.description: Updates the player list tab without having to open it.

error_log.name: client.error_log
error_log.description: Logs a message to console in the error format and plays the sound (If Hide from OBS is disabled)

args.description: Optional comma-separated arguments to concatenate with msg.

set_string.name: cvar_object:set_string
set_string.description: Sets the int, float and string value to the passed float. Invokes the change callback

set_float.name: cvar_object:set_float
set_float.description: Sets the int, float and string value to the passed float. Invokes the change callback

set_raw_float.name: cvar_object:set_raw_float
set_raw_float.description: This sets the float value without changing the integer and string values.

get_float.name: cvar_object:get_float
get_float.description: Returns nil if called on a ConCommand.

set_int.name: cvar_object:set_int
set_int.description: Sets the int, float and string value to the passed float. Invokes the change callback

set_raw_int.name: cvar_object:set_raw_int
set_raw_int.description: This sets the integer value without changing the float and string values.

get_int.name: cvar_object:get_int
get_int.description: Returns nil if called on a ConCommand.

invoke_callback.name: cvar_object:invoke_callback
invoke_callback.description: Executes a ConCommand or cvar callback, passing its arguments to it

read.name: database.read
read.description: Gets a value from the database

args.name: key_name
args.description: String used as a name of the key. Make sure to write to the same key_name.

write.name: database.write
write.description: Writes a value to the database. Avoid calling this often. For example, call read at script load, then call write during the 'shutdown' event

args.name: key_name
args.description: String used as a name of the key.

args.name: value
args.description: Value the key should be set to. This can be anything that can be sanitized (no functions, userdata)

get_local_player.name: entity.get_local_player
get_local_player.description: Returns the entity index for the local player, or nil on failure.

get_all.name: entity.get_all
get_all.description: Returns an array of entity indices. Pass no arguments for all entities.

args.name: classname
args.description: Optional string that specifies the class name of entities that will be added to the list, for example "CCSPlayer".

get_players.name: entity.get_players
get_players.description: Returns an array of player entity indices. Dormant and dead players will not be added to the list.

args.name: enemies_only
args.description: Optional. If true then you and the players on your team will not be added to the list.

get_game_rules.name: entity.get_game_rules
get_game_rules.description: Returns entity index of CCSGameRulesProxy instance, or nil if none exists.

get_player_resource.name: entity.get_player_resource
get_player_resource.description: Returns entity index of CCSPlayerResource instance, or nil if none exists.

get_classname.name: entity.get_classname
get_classname.description: Returns the name of the entity's class, or nil on failure.

set_prop.name: entity.set_prop

args.name: value
args.description: The property will be set to this value. For vectors or angles, separate the components by commas.

args.name: array_index
args.description: Optional. If propname is an array, the value at this array index will be set.

set_prop.description: Sets the value of the property. For vectors or angles, pass three values.

get_prop.name: entity.get_prop
get_prop.description: Returns the value of the property, or nil on failure. For vectors or angles, this returns three values.

args.name: array_index
args.description: Optional. If propname is an array, the value at this array index will be returned.

is_enemy.name: entity.is_enemy
is_enemy.description: Returns true if the entity is on the other team.

is_alive.name: entity.is_alive
is_alive.description: Returns true if the player is not dead.

is_dormant.name: entity.is_dormant
is_dormant.description: Returns true if the player is not dormant.

get_player_name.name: entity.get_player_name
get_player_name.description: Returns the player's name, or the string "unknown" on failure.

get_player_weapon.name: entity.get_player_weapon
get_player_weapon.description: Returns the entity index of the player's active weapon, or nil if the player is not alive, dormant, etc.

hitbox_position.name: entity.hitbox_position
hitbox_position.description: Returns world coordinates x, y, z, or nil on failure.

args.name: hitbox
args.description: Either a string of the hitbox name, or an integer index of the hitbox.

get_steam64.name: entity.get_steam64
get_steam64.description: Returns steamID3, or nil on failure.

get_bounding_box.name: entity.get_bounding_box
get_bounding_box.description: Returns x1, y1, x2, y2, alpha_multiplier. The contents of x1, y1, x2, y2 must be ignored when alpha_multiplier is zero, which indicates that the bounding box is invalid and should not be drawn.

realtime.name: globals.realtime
realtime.description: Returns the local time in seconds.

curtime.name: globals.curtime
curtime.description: Returns the game time in seconds. This number is synchronized with the server.

frametime.name: globals.frametime
frametime.description: Returns the number of seconds elapsed during the last game frame.

absoluteframetime.name: globals.absoluteframetime
absoluteframetime.description: Returns the number of seconds elapsed during the last game frame.

maxplayers.name: globals.maxplayers
maxplayers.description: Returns the maximum number of players in the server.

tickcount.name: globals.tickcount
tickcount.description: Returns the number of ticks elapsed in the server.

tickinterval.name: globals.tickinterval
tickinterval.description: Returns the time elapsed in one game tick in seconds.

framecount.name: globals.framecount
framecount.description: Returns the number of frames since the game started

mapname.name: globals.mapname
mapname.description: Returns the name of the loaded map, or nil if you are not in game.

lastoutgoingcommand.name: globals.lastoutgoingcommand
lastoutgoingcommand.description: Returns the command number of the last outgoing command.

chokedcommands.name: globals.chokedcommands
chokedcommands.description: Returns the current number of commands that are being held back.

oldcommandack.name: globals.oldcommandack
oldcommandack.description: Returns the previous server acknowledged command number.

commandack.name: globals.commandack
commandack.description: Returns the number of the command the server last acknowledged.

arms_material.name: materialsystem.arms_material
arms_material.description: Returns the players hand cham material as an object.

chams_material.name: materialsystem.chams_material
chams_material.description: Returns the players cham material as an object.

find_material.name: materialsystem.find_material
find_material.description: Returns a material object for the specified material.

find_materials.name: materialsystem.find_materials
find_materials.description: Returns all material objects that contain the specified material.

args.name: materials
args.description: The substring that the material name must contain.

find_texture.name: materialsystem.find_texture
find_texture.description: Returns a texture object for the specified material.

get_model_materials.name: materialsystem.get_model_materials
get_model_materials.description: Returns all material objects for a specified entity.

args.name: entindex
args.description: The entity whos materials will be returned.

override_material.name: materialsystem.override_material
override_material.description: Overrides all of a material properties with another material.

args.name: entindex
args.description: The entity whos materials will be returned.

alpha_modulate.name: material_object:alpha_modulate
alpha_modulate.description: Overrides the alpha of the material object it's called on. Doesn't work with some materials

args.name: a
args.description: New alpha value of the material (0-255)

color_modulate.name: material_object:color_modulate
color_modulate.description: Overrides the color of the material object it's called on. Doesn't work with some materials

args.name: r
args.description: New red value of the material (0-255)

args.name: g
args.description: New green value of the material (0-255)

args.name: b
args.description: New blue value of the material (0-255)

reload.name: material_object:reload
reload.description: Restores the original material properties of the material it's called on.

get_material_var_flag.name: material_object:get_material_var_flag
get_material_var_flag.description: Returns the boolean value of the material var flag

set_material_var_flag.name: material_object:set_material_var_flag
set_material_var_flag.description: Sets the value of the material var flag of the material

args.name: value
args.description: New boolean value of the material var flag

get_shader_param.name: material_object:get_shader_param
get_shader_param.description: Returns the value of the shader param or nil

set_shader_param.name: material_object:set_shader_param
set_shader_param.description: Sets the value of the shader param of the material

args.name: value
args.description: New value of the shader param

text.name: renderer.text
text.description: This can only be called from the paint callback.

args.name: flags
args.description: "+" for large text, "-" for small text, "c" for centered text, "r" for right-aligned text, "b" for bold text. "c" can be combined with other flags. nil can be specified for normal sized uncentered text.

args.name: max_width
args.description: Text will be clipped if it exceeds this width in pixels. Use 0 for no limit.

measure_text.name: renderer.measure_text
measure_text.description: Returns width, height. This can only be called from the paint callback.

args.name: flags
args.description: "+" for large text, "-" for small text, or nil for normal sized text.

rectangle.name: renderer.rectangle
rectangle.description: This can only be called from the paint callback.

line.name: renderer.line
line.description: This can only be called from the paint callback.

gradient.name: renderer.gradient
gradient.description: This can only be called from the paint callback.

args.name: ltr
args.description: Left to right. Pass true for horizontal gradient, or false for vertical.

circle.name: renderer.circle
circle.description: This can only be called from the paint callback.

args.name: radius
args.description: Radius of the circle in pixels.

args.name: start_degrees
args.description: 0 is the right side, 90 is the bottom, 180 is the left, 270 is the top.

args.name: percentage
args.description: Must be within [0.0-1.0]. 1.0 is a full circle, 0.5 is a half circle, etc.

circle_outline.name: renderer.circle_outline
circle_outline.description: This can only be called from the paint callback.

args.name: radius
args.description: Radius of the circle in pixels.

args.name: start_degrees
args.description: 0 is the right side, 90 is the bottom, 180 is the left, 270 is the top.

args.name: percentage
args.description: Must be within [0.0-1.0]. 1.0 is a full circle, 0.5 is a half circle, etc.

args.name: thickness
args.description: Thickness of the outline in pixels.

triangle.name: renderer.triangle
triangle.description: This can only be called from the paint callback.

args.name: x0
args.description: Screen coordinate X for point A

args.name: y0
args.description: Screen coordinate Y for point A

args.name: x1
args.description: Screen coordinate X for point B

args.name: y1
args.description: Screen coordinate Y for point B

args.name: x2
args.description: Screen coordinate X for point C

args.name: y2
args.description: Screen coordinate Y for point C

world_to_screen.name: renderer.world_to_screen
world_to_screen.description: Returns two screen coordinates (x, y), or nil if the world position is not visible on your screen. This can only be called from the paint callback.

indicator.name: renderer.indicator
indicator.description: Returns the Y screen coordinate (vertical offset) of the drawn text, or nil on failure. This can only be called from the paint callback.

args.description: The text that will be drawn

texture.name: renderer.texture
texture.description: Draws a texture from the texture id created from load_png, load_jpg or load_svg

load_svg.name: renderer.load_svg
load_svg.description: Returns a texture ID that can be used with renderer.texture, or nil on failure

load_png.name: renderer.load_png
load_png.description: Returns a texture ID that can be used with renderer.texture, or nil on failure

load_jpg.name: renderer.load_jpg
load_jpg.description: Returns a texture ID that can be used with renderer.texture, or nil on failure

new_checkbox.name: ui.new_checkbox
new_checkbox.description: Returns a special value that can be passed to ui.get and ui.set, or throws an error on failure.

args.name: tab
args.description: The name of the tab: AA, RAGE, LEGIT, MISC, PLAYERS, SKINS, VISUALS or LUA.

args.name: container
args.description: The name of the existing container to which this control will be added.

new_slider.name: ui.new_slider
new_slider.description: Returns a special value that can be passed to ui.get and ui.set, or throws an error on failure.

args.name: tab
args.description: The name of the tab: AA, RAGE, LEGIT, MISC, PLAYERS, SKINS, VISUALS or LUA.

args.name: container
args.description: The name of the existing container to which this control will be added.

args.name: min
args.description: The minimum value that can be set using the slider.

args.name: max
args.description: The maximum value that can be set using the slider.

args.name: init_value
args.description: Optional integer. The initial value. If not provided, the initial value will be min.

args.name: show_tooltip
args.description: Optional boolean. true if the slider should display its current value.

args.name: unit
args.description: Optional string that is two characters or less. This will be appended to the display value. For example, "px" for pixels or "%" for a percentage.

args.name: scale
args.description: Optional The display value will be multiplied by this scale. For example, 0.1 will make a slider with the range [0-1800] show as 0.0-180.0 with one decimal place.

args.name: tooltips
args.description: Optional table used to override the tooltip for the specified values. The key must be within min-max. The value is a string that will be shown instead of the numeric value whenever that value is selected.

new_combobox.name: ui.new_combobox
new_combobox.description: Returns a special value that can be passed to ui.get and ui.set, or throws an error on failure.

args.name: tab
args.description: The name of the tab: AA, RAGE, LEGIT, MISC, PLAYERS, SKINS, VISUALS or LUA.

args.name: container
args.description: The name of the existing container to which this control will be added.
One or more comma separated string values that will be added to the combobox. Alternatively, a table of strings that will be added.

new_multiselect.name: ui.new_multiselect
new_multiselect.description: Returns a special value that can be passed to ui.get and ui.set, or throws an error on failure.

args.name: tab
args.description: The name of the tab: AA, RAGE, LEGIT, MISC, PLAYERS, SKINS, VISUALS or LUA.

args.name: container
args.description: The name of the existing container to which this control will be added.
One or more comma separated string values that will be added to the combobox. Alternatively, a table of strings that will be added.

new_hotkey.name: ui.new_hotkey
new_hotkey.description: Returns a special value that can be passed to ui.get to see if the hotkey is pressed, or throws an error on failure.

args.name: tab
args.description: The name of the tab: AA, RAGE, LEGIT, MISC, PLAYERS, SKINS, VISUALS or LUA.

args.name: container
args.description: The name of the existing container to which this control will be added.

args.name: inline
args.description: Optional boolean. If set to true, the hotkey will be placed to the right of the preceding menu item.

new_button.name: ui.new_button
new_button.description: Throws an error on failure. The return value should not be used with ui.set or ui.get.

args.name: tab
args.description: The name of the tab: AA, RAGE, LEGIT, MISC, PLAYERS, SKINS, VISUALS or LUA.

args.name: container
args.description: The name of the existing container to which this checkbox will be added.

args.name: callback
args.description: The lua function that will be called when the button is pressed.

new_color_picker.name: ui.new_color_picker
new_color_picker.description: Throws an error on failure. The color picker is placed to the right of the previous menu item.

args.name: tab
args.description: The name of the tab: AA, RAGE, LEGIT, MISC, PLAYERS, SKINS, VISUALS or LUA.

args.name: container
args.description: The name of the existing container to which this checkbox will be added.

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the color picker. This will not be shown, it is only used to identify this item in saved configs.

new_textbox.name: ui.new_textbox
new_textbox.description: Throws an error on failure. Returns a special value that can be used with ui.get

args.name: tab
args.description: The name of the tab: AA, RAGE, LEGIT, MISC, PLAYERS, SKINS, VISUALS or LUA.

args.name: container
args.description: The name of the existing container to which this textbox will be added.

reference.name: ui.reference
reference.description: Avoid calling this from inside a function. Returns a reference that can be passed to ui.get and ui.set, or throws an error on failure. This allows you to access a built-in pre-existing menu items. This function returns multiple values when the specified menu item is followed by unnamed menu items, for example a color picker or a hotkey.

args.name: tab
args.description: The name of the tab: AA, RAGE, LEGIT, MISC, PLAYERS, SKINS, VISUALS or LUA.

args.name: container
args.description: The name of the existing container to which this checkbox will be added.

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the menu item.

set.name: ui.set
set.description: For checkboxes, pass true or false. For a slider, pass a number that is within the slider's minimum/maximum values. For a combobox, pass a string value. For a multiselect combobox, pass zero or more strings. For referenced buttons, param is ignored and the button's callback is invoked. For color pickers, pass the arguments r, g, b, a.

args.name: item
args.description: The result of either ui.new_checkbox, ui.new_slider, or ui.reference.

args.name: value
args.description: The value to which the menu item will be set.
Optional. For multiselect comboboxes, you may want to set more than one option.

get.name: ui.get
get.description: For a checkbox, returns true or false. For a slider, returns an integer. For a combobox, returns a string. For a multiselect combobox, returns an array of strings. For a hotkey, returns true if the hotkey is active. For a color picker, returns r, g, b, a. Throws an error on failure.

args.name: item
args.description: The special value returned by ui.new_checkbox, ui.new_slider, ui.new_combobox, ui.new_hotkey, or ui.reference.

set_callback.name: ui.set_callback

args.name: item
args.description: The special value returned by ui.new_*. Do not try passing a reference to an existing menu item.

args.name: callback
args.description: Lua function that will be called when the menu item changes values. For example, this will be called when the user checks or unchecks a checkbox.

set_callback.description: Sets the change callback of a custom menu item. It will be executed on change and passed the reference

set_visible.name: ui.set_visible

args.name: visible
args.description: Boolean. Pass false to hide the control from the menu.

set_visible.description: Sets the visibility of the menu item

is_menu_open.name: ui.is_menu_open
is_menu_open.description: Returns true if the menu is currently open.

mouse_position.name: ui.mouse_position
mouse_position.description: Returns current mouse coordinates x, y

new_listbox.name: ui.new_listbox
new_listbox.description: Returns a special value that can be passed to ui.get and ui.set, or throws an error on failure.

args.name: tab
args.description: The name of the tab: AA, RAGE, LEGIT, MISC, PLAYERS, SKINS, VISUALS or LUA.

args.name: container
args.description: The name of the existing container to which this control will be added.
One or more comma separated string values that will be added to the listbox. Alternatively, a table of strings that will be added.

new_string.name: ui.new_string
new_string.description: Creates a string UI element, can be used to store arbitrary strings in configs. No menu item is created but it has the same semantics as other ui.new_* functions. Returns a special value that can be passed to ui.get and ui.set, or throws an error on failure.

args.name: name
args.description: The name of the string element, make sure this is unique.

args.name: default_value
args.description: Optional default value of the element.

name.name: ui.name
name.description: Returns the name of the menu item reference passed to it. Throws an error on failure.

args.name: item
args.description: The special value returned by ui.new_checkbox, ui.new_slider, ui.new_combobox, ui.new_hotkey, or ui.reference.
